article.headline: Auburn 73, Belmont 69
article.story: AUBURN, Ala. (AP) -- Toney Douglas scored 22 points and Quinnel Brown added 19 points, leading Auburn to a 73-69 victory over Belmont on Thursday night. Douglas made 7-of-16 from the field and was perfect in six free throw attempts. Brown pulled down a career-high 11 rebounds for the Tigers (9-4), who dominated the boards 36-33. Nathan Watson added 12 points. Dan Oliver hit 6-of-10 field goals to lead Belmont (2-7) with 15 points. Andrew Preston added 12 points and Justin Hare had 10. Hare's shot with 9 second narrowed the final margin. The Tigers held Belmont to 33 percent first-half shooting to take a 32-24 halftime lead, but allowed the Bruins to outscore them 45-41 in the second half to cut the deficit. Belmont also capitalized on Auburn's 16 turnovers, scoring 14 points.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
